page.title: 17POLICING IN SHREWSBURY.
page.content: Shrewsbury is policed by{"F" Division of the{West Mercia Police Force.}It is made up of 234 officers of varying rank. The police day is divided into three eight hour shifts. The crime detection figures for 1984 are rather poor but it must be remembered that many officers were out of the district on picket line duty. The crimes which occur most frequently are burglary of private dwellings and other buildings and the theft of, and from motor cars. In both these categories the detection rate is well below{40%.}Crimes related to alcohol appear to be increasing, with under age drinking and drunken driving the major contributors.{Crime {prevention}plays a major role in police work; property marking schemes have been organised and the police are always willing to advise people on how best to secure their property.
